sections.title: Handling the state and events of advertising
sections.chapter: Working with the built-in capabilities of the SDK

inlineContent.text: This tutorial will help you observe and respond to changes in the state and events of advertisements. In it, we will continue the development of the application we started in the previous section.
Observe the state of advertisements to react appropriately within the application.
Let’s go back to the AdCell file.
As you may remember, our implementation is not entirely correct because we send the
state and pass
to
without checking whether the advertising content has been loaded.
The state of the advertisement is represented through the
enum. Thanks to this, we can understand at which stage of the loading process our advertisement currently is.
To access the current state of the
, you can use the
property. However, in our case, we want to observe changes in this state. For this purpose, you can use
or
The next step is to respond to changes in the advertisement state in our
. If the advertisement is in the
or
stage, we want to display the
state of the advertisement. If the advertisement is
, we want to send a signal to display the
. If the advertisement encounters an
during loading or decoding, we send an error state to our

You can handle errors as you see fit. In our application we will implement it in a way that when an error related to decoding is encountered, the advertisement will attempt to reload the content, and only after a second error is received, it will be displayed on the screen.

tasks.title: Handling errors during the loading and decoding of advertisements

inlineContent.text: Let’s continue with our
method.
First, we need to understand if the error is related to decoding. If you are not using custom native renderers, the type of error you can get from the SDK will always be
. Thanks to it, you can find out the reason of the error.
Now let’s add a
property, which will keep track of how many times we have attempted to reload the advertisement. If we receive a
error and
is equal to zero, we will increment the
by 1 and call the
method, which will attempt to make the request again.
Observe the advertising events to respond to them in the application.
Let’s continue with our
The SDK can send many events related to advertisements. It may be useful for you to observe them, for example, for debugging or other purposes. To do this, you can use
or
Note: in the case of a tap event, the URL can either represent the URL to which the user was redirected in the browser, or the URL that the SDK processed without the user’s knowledge.
Advertising events in the SDK are represented as the
enum. Let’s add the following logic – if the user tap on the advertisement, we want to find out which URL was associated with this event.

In addition, the SDK can observe the percentage of visibility of the advertisement on the screen and send events related to this to the server if it was configured in such a way on the server. This can be useful if you are displaying advertisements in a
. Open the FirstScreen file.
Import AdSDKSwiftUI and add the
modifier to your List. This allows the
, which is in the hierarchy of the
, to understand its percentage of visibility on the screen.
Now, if your advertisement was configured on the server to track the percentage of visibility on the screen, you can observe
event.
